answerText: lithium[10] n-Butyllithium is a notable example of a compound that is basic, but lacks this other property. Molecules with this property donate a pair of electrons when forming a covalent bond.
heading: SUBMIT |2014 | Penn A, Louisville | 8 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] Identify this lightest of the alkaline metals, which is also present in a namesake type of organometallic reagent that is similar to, but stronger than, Grignard reagents.
